about.description:
The DWARF Debugging Information Format is of interest to programmers working on compilers and
debuggers (and anyone interested in reading or writing DWARF information). It was developed by a
committee (known as the PLSIG at the time) starting around 1991. Starting around 1991 SGI got
involved with the committee and then developed the libdwarf and dwarfdump tools for SGI-internal
use and as part of SGI IRIX developer tools. From around 1993 dwarfdump and libdwarf were
shipped (as an executable and archive respectively, not source) with every release of the SGI
MIPS/IRIX C compiler. In 1994 (I think the correct year) SGI agreed (at my request) to
open-source libdwarf (and in 1999 to open-source dwarfdump) so anyone could use them.
about.summary: a library for manipulating DWARF Debugging Information Format (headers & dev stuff)

name: libdwarf-dev
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.21.8
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: libdwarf-dev
  version: 0.3.4
source:
  patches:
    - patches/0001-add-enable_libdwarf-and-enable_dwarfdump-to-configur.patch
    - patches/0001-use-PATH-resolution-when-testing-dwarfdump.patch
  sha256: 71e1aa48eb5489f0e020826a13aee42c76135212cccbb1c7ba686214d4e47d5f
  url: https://github.com/davea42/libdwarf-code/releases/download/v0.3.4/libdwarf-0.3.4.tar.xz
build:
  number: 0
  run_exports:
    - libdwarf >=0.3.4,<1.0a0
  string: h753d276_0
requirements:
  build:
    - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 1_gnu
    - binutils_impl_linux-64 2.36.1 h193b22a_2
    - binutils_linux-64 2.36 hf3e587d_9
    - gcc_impl_linux-64 10.3.0 hf2f2afa_15
    - gcc_linux-64 10.3.0 hc39de41_9
    - kernel-headers_linux-64 2.6.32 he073ed8_15
    - ld_impl_linux-64 2.36.1 hea4e1c9_2
    - libgcc-devel_linux-64 10.3.0 he6cfe16_15
    - libgcc-ng 11.2.0 h1d223b6_15
    - libgomp 11.2.0 h1d223b6_15
    - libsanitizer 10.3.0 h26c7422_15
    - libstdcxx-ng 11.2.0 he4da1e4_15
    - sysroot_linux-64 2.12 he073ed8_15
  host:
    - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 1_gnu
    - libgcc-ng 11.2.0 h1d223b6_15
    - libgomp 11.2.0 h1d223b6_15
    - libzlib 1.2.11 h166bdaf_1014
    - zlib 1.2.11 h166bdaf_1014
  run:
    - libdwarf 0.3.4 h753d276_0
    - libgcc-ng >=10.3.0
    - libzlib >=1.2.11,<1.3.0a0
test:
  commands:
    - pkg-config --print-provides libdwarf
    - pkg-config --print-errors --exact-version=$PKG_VERSION libdwarf
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/libdwarf.h
    - test -f $PREFIX/include/libdwarf-?/dwarf.h
    - test -f $PREFIX/lib/libdwarf${SHLIB_EXT}
  requires:
    - pkg-config
    - zlib >=1.2.11,<1.3.0a0
about:
  description: 'The DWARF Debugging Information Format is of interest to programmers
    working on compilers and

    debuggers (and anyone interested in reading or writing DWARF information). It
    was developed by a

    committee (known as the PLSIG at the time) starting around 1991. Starting around
    1991 SGI got

    involved with the committee and then developed the libdwarf and dwarfdump tools
    for SGI-internal

    use and as part of SGI IRIX developer tools. From around 1993 dwarfdump and libdwarf
    were

    shipped (as an executable and archive respectively, not source) with every release
    of the SGI

    MIPS/IRIX C compiler. In 1994 (I think the correct year) SGI agreed (at my request)
    to

    open-source libdwarf (and in 1999 to open-source dwarfdump) so anyone could use
    them.

    '
  dev_url: https://github.com/davea42/libdwarf-code
  doc_url: https://www.prevanders.net/libdwarfdoc/
  home: https://www.prevanders.net/dwarf.html
  license: LGPL-2.1-only
  license_family: GPL
  license_file:
    - COPYING
    - src/lib/libdwarf/COPYING
    - src/lib/libdwarf/LGPL.txt
    - src/lib/libdwarf/LIBDWARFCOPYRIGHT
  summary: a library for manipulating DWARF Debugging Information Format (headers
    & dev stuff)
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  feedstock-name: libdwarf
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - timsnyder
